Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Born on the Fourth of July" (1989) directed by Oliver Stone. This movie is based on the true story of Ron Kovic who was paralyzed in the Vietnam war and became an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country for which he fought.
The acting in this movie is superb, especially the performance of Tom Cruise as Ron Kovic. The cinematography in this movie is also excellent, especially the use of wide-angle lenses to capture the vastness of the countryside during Ron's recuperation period at home.
Overall, "Born on the Fourth of July" (1989) directed by Oliver Stone is an excellent movie that tells a true story about an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist who was paralyzed in the Vietnam war.
